description: The Palestinian city, located on the border with Egypt and whose development dates back to the Pharaohs, is now a field of rubble, writes historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

headline: US tariffs cast a shadow over Champagne's harvest
description: The joint statement published on August 21 by the EU and the US confirms that European spirits are now subject to a 15% import tariff when entering the American market.

Is 'abundance' the new watchword of US Democrats?
description: Born in California, the concept of 'abundance' has captivated the centrist wing of the Democratic Party. It advocates for an interventionist state paired with deregulation to facilitate investment and increase the supply of essential goods such as housing, energy, transportation and healthcare.

headline: Being a writer in the digital age? James Baldwin 'seemed free in ways we no longer can be'
description: 'Letters from America' (6/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams envies the great American author's bohemian, technology-free existence, despite the chaos it represented.

headline: Spike in suspicious incidents in Iran fuels fears of a simmering war
description: Iranians remain on edge two months after the end of the 12-day war, worried about renewed fighting with Israel and burdened by inflation and water and power shortages.
